definition: to worry/to be on one's mind

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)

sentences.english: He's not pathological or anything, he says.
sentences.chinese: 他曾说，挂心不等于病态的忧心忡忡。

sentences.english: Never mind on defend-stick or shooting-block some issue therefor.
sentences.chinese: 对于防守时的卡位或是射击时的挡住队友都无须挂心。

sentences.english: I am anxious about her safety.
Cricket is a religion with John.
sentences.chinese: 打板球是约翰最挂心的事。

sentences.english: It's the other ones that Wade worries about.
sentences.chinese: 这是韦德最挂心的另一件事。

sentences.english: Don't worry, you can leave the child in my care.
sentences.chinese: 不必挂心，你们可把孩子托付给我。

sentences.english: When they can’t have something, people do care.
sentences.chinese: 对于无法拥有的东西，人们会挂心。

definition: to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
variant of 擔心|担心[dan1 xin1]
urgent/in a great hurry/in intimate relationship with sb
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
